byline.original: By ROBIN POGREBIN, BRETT SOKOL and HILARIE M. SHEETS

abstract: Inside Art column; Frick Collection plans 2016 exhibition of paintings by 18th-century French artist Jean-Antoine Watteau; Margulies Collection at the Warehouse in Miami mounts permanent exhibition of Anselm Kiefer works; first public sculpture by Deborah Kass will be installed at Brooklyn Bridge Park.
lead_paragraph: A Jean-Antoine Watteau exhibition is on tap for the Frick Collection, a Kiefer retrospective and a terse two-sided greeting to New York from Deborah Kass.

headline.main: Watteau in Wartime, and a Miami Showcase for Anselm Kiefer
headline.print_headline: Watteau in Wartime, Off the Battlefield

snippet: A Jean-Antoine Watteau exhibition is on tap for the Frick Collection, a Kiefer retrospective and a terse two-sided greeting to New York from Deborah Kass.

keywords.value: Margulies Collection at the Warehouse (Miami, Fla)
